meanings.definition: Experienced or done by each of two or more parties towards the other or others.
meanings.sent1: Their mutual respect for each other strengthened their friendship.
meanings.sent2: The mutual agreement between the neighbors made living next to each other easier.
meanings.sent3: It was a mutual decision to try the new restaurant, and they ended up loving it.
meanings.sent4: Their mutual understanding was like a bridge connecting their different perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The mutual support they provided each other was unwavering and heartwarming.

meanings.definition: Held in common by two or more parties.
meanings.sent1: The mutual ownership of the park ensured it was well-maintained.
meanings.sent2: They had a mutual interest in gardening, so they decided to start a community garden.
meanings.sent3: Their mutual love for ice cream led to a friendly competition to try new flavors.
meanings.sent4: The mutual responsibility for the project brought them closer together as a team.
meanings.sent5: The mutual goal of creating a peaceful environment united the entire neighborhood.
